memberdef.argsstring: (modificationStateBH_e *modificationFlag, const T_DL_AdaptAndCoding_b *const pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_b_s, const T_DL_AdaptAndCoding_u8 *const pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_u8_s)
memberdef.name: get_doorlockingAdaptAndCoding

detaileddescription.para: Wrapper to check the adaptation and coding and store it appropriately.

If a different adaptation or coding was discovered, it is stored, and the modification flag is set accordingly. Invoked in BAPHandler_Doorlocking_TaskCyclicEvent and bapi_Doorlocking_VerifyAdaptAndCoding
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must ensure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
N/A
N/A
modificationStateBH_e
*modificationFlag range 0u - 3u 0u - no modification 1u - modified 2u - function list modified 3u - init ATN [in, out] const T_DL_AdaptAndCoding_b * const pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_b_s Stores the adaptation and coding for corresponding RTE read function list, limited to a boolean value. [in, out] const T_DL_AdaptAndCoding_u8 * const pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_u8_s Stores the adaptation and coding for corresponding RTE read function list, limited to an uint8 value.
Std_ReturnType RTE_E_INVALID - there was an error in processing the function RTE_E_OK - function processed correctly RTE_E_NEVER_RECEIVED - at least one adaption was not written yet in current power cycle
Globals
N/A
Input->Output-Correlation
The funcion is used to check if there were any changes to the adaption or coding for any of the functions on the provided function list. If there was no change, modificationFlag is set to 'no modification'. If there was a change, modificationFlag is set to 'modified', and the new data is stored accordingly in pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_b_s.data_b or pRte_Read_AdaptCoding_u8_s.data_u8. If everything went correctly, RTE_E_OK is returned. If during the check, it is revealed that at least one adaption was not written yet in current power cycle, RTE_E_NEVER_RECEIVED is returned instead
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_get_doorlockingAdaptAndCoding_T1 TEST_get_doorlockingAdaptAndCoding_T2
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. A wrapper function was needed for adaptation and coding checking
Controls the verification of adaption and coding every 3s.

Invoked in bapi_BH_DoorlockingState_functionsReady.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must ensure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous
N/A
N/A
void
void
Globals
Affected variables: [in, out] counterDoorlocking_u16
Input->Output-Correlation
If counterDoorlocking_u16 is 0, it is set to DL_COUNTER and bapi_Doorlocking_VerifyAdaptAndCoding is invoked. Else counterDoorlocking_u16 is decreased by 1.
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_Doorlocking_CyclicVerification
Traceability
Design Decision - Justification. This function was needed for cyclic adaptation and coding verification
Verifies the adaptation and coding.

Invoked every 300ms by bapi_Doorlocking_CyclicVerification.

Input->Output-Correlation
Checks if there was a change in adaption and/or coding by invoking get_doorlockingAdaptAndCoding. If there is a change, counterDoorlocking_u16, BAPHandler_DL_state and BAPHandler_DL_Freigabe_b are set accordingly.
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_Doorlocking_VerifyAdaptAndCoding
Traceability

Invokes the initialization of BAP specific functions and function updates.

Checks if the initialization and update was executed correctly. Invoked in bapi_BH_DoorlockingState_adaptAndCodingUpdate.

Input->Output-Correlation
Initalization of BAP specific functions and function updates is invoked. If it is comleted successfully, counterDoorlocking_u16 is set to DL_COUNTER and BAPHandler_DL_state is set to stateBH_BAPfunctions_ready.

Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_Doorlocking_UpdateAdaptAndCoding

Resets Doorlocking PSO to default or factory settings.

Invoked in bapi_BH_DoorlockingState_resetToDefaultSettings.
reentrant No context task context thread safe No - Integration must ensure that the function is not interrupted by the other functions of the same module multicore safe No - All APIs needs to be called from the same core synchronous

BAPHandlerState_e
const state - not used in function
void Globals
Affected variables: [in, out] counterDoorlocking_u16 [in, out] BAPHandler_DL_state [out] NvMPim_BAPHandler_DL_PSO_prop_ps
Input->Output-Correlation
If counterDoorlocking_u16 is zero, NvMPim_BAPHandler_DL_PSO_prop_ps is set to factory settings. If counterDoorlocking_u16 is equal to DL_RESETCOUNTER, NvMPim_BAPHandler_DL_PSO_prop_ps is set to default settings, and counterDoorlocking_u16 is decreased by 1.
Call Sequence

SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_Doorlocking_ResetToDefaults

Input->Output-Correlation
If Bap_Doorlocking is not started, BAPHandler_DL_state is set to stateBH_Start and BAPHandler_DL_Freigabe_b is set to FALSE. If BAP has already started for remote services, the following functions are invoked: bapi_Doorlocking_handleRemoteControlAuthentication bapi_Doorlocking_RemoteControlChallenge_Check bapi_Doorlocking_TheftProtectionSensorSetup_Check bapi_Doorlocking_processPSOverification bapi_Doorlocking_NvM_DataUpdate bapi_Doorlocking_CyclicVerification
Call Sequence
Test Method
SWATT unit tests. The testing method is described in: TEST_bapi_BH_DoorlockingState_functionsReady
